block.p: AMOCO CORP., Chicago, promoted John L. Carl, senior vice president for finance and controller, to executive vice president and chief financial officer, succeeding Frederick S. Addy, who is retiring. CHEVRON SHIPPING CO., San Francisco, a subsidiary of the Chevron Corporation, named Thomas R. Moore president, succeeding Douglas C. Wolcott, who is retiring.

AMOCO CORP., Chicago, promoted John L. Carl, senior vice president for finance and controller, to executive vice president and chief financial officer, succeeding Frederick S. Addy, who is retiring. CHEVRON SHIPPING CO., San Francisco, a subsidiary of the Chevron Corporation, named Thomas R. Moore president, succeeding Douglas C. Wolcott, who is retiring.

LEBENTHAL & CO., New York, appointed James Gammon president of Lebenthal Asset Management Inc., a new asset management unit. WYSE TECHNOLOGY INC., San Jose, Calif., a supplier of microprocessor-based products, promoted Gary Anderson, its vice president of finance, to senior vice president and chief financial officer. COMPANY NEWS
